fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.computers.interfaces

Interface ComputerStaticStateI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, java.io.Serializable, TimeStampingI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerStaticState

    public interface ComputerStaticStateI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, TimeStampingI
    The class ComputerStaticStateI implements objects representing the static state information of computers transmitted through the ComputerStaticStateDataI interface of Computer components.

    Description

    The interface is used to type objects pulled from or pushed by a computer using a data interface in pull or push mode. It gives access to static information, that is information *not* subject to changes during the existence of the computer. Data objects are timestamped in standard Unix local time format, with the IP of the computer doing this timestamp.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 14, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
